result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley S Conkle

records.addlTxt: from atty Schutte requesting 1 day credit in 22CF37

10:23 am-CASES: 22CF37 & 21CF400.  10:18 AM Defendant Wesley S Conkle in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Wesley S Conkle.  Attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-CLERK. 
21CF400-Count 3-poss meth STRIKING REPEATER-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
All other counts-DRI
CT finds def waiving PSI

22CF37-Count 2-fel bail jumping with repeater-guilty plea.  CT does NOT accept plea at this time. Deferred agreement filed with the court.  $150 to be paid to the DA office.  
Count 1-DRI

SENTENCE:
21CF400-Count 3-w/h, probation up to 3 yrs. May petition for early discharge if completes txt court.  Successfully comply w/ terms of txt court, comply with terms of CPS in juv files.  Must follow thru with Programs for Change.  Must follow rules of supervision.  Must report to probation today.  9 mo CT, subj to WR, no GT-stayed.  Sentence credit to be provided w/in 30 days. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $300.05 fine.  60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 
PCR.  10:40 am adj.
15 days pre-arraignment rights.  Reading waived.  NG entered.  Parties have an agreement.

10:18 AM Defendant Wesley S Conkle in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Wesley S Conkle.  Attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-CLERK.  Schutte-parties have a resolution.
22CF37-Waiver of PH-CT finds def waiving PH.  CT finds PC, def bound over.

CASES: 21CF400 & 22CF37.  01:02 PM Defendant Wesley S Conkle in court with attorney A.W. Schutte.  Defendant Wesley S Conkle in custody.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk
Schutte-asking for an adjournment.  Scheduling/status to remain on calendar for 4/11.  Bonds cont.  1:07 pm adj.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
No controlled substances without a prescription.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Must be in compliance with CPS/CHIPS case.

01:03 PM Defendant Wesley S Conkle appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Benjamin James Webster appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for defendant.  CW-clerk.  Reading waived.  CT sets bond.  WSPH.  1:08 am adj.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
